turns.content: is the number of integers equal to the number of real numbers?

No, the number of integers is a finite set, while the number of real numbers is infinite. An integer is a whole number, either positive, negative, or zero, while a real number is any number that can be represented on the number line. This includes not only integers, but also fractions, decimals, and irrational numbers. Because there are an infinite number of real numbers, there are many more real numbers than there are integers.
is the number of integers equal to the number of rational numbers?

No, the number of integers is still a finite set, while the number of rational numbers is also infinite. A rational number is any number that can be expressed as the ratio of two integers, such as 3/4 or 22/7. This includes all integers, as well as many other numbers that can be represented as a simple fraction. Because there are an infinite number of rational numbers, there are many more rational numbers than there are integers.
Are you sure that the set of integers is finite? I don't think that's correct.

You are correct, the set of integers is infinite, not finite. I apologize for the error. The set of integers includes all positive and negative whole numbers, as well as zero, and it goes on forever in both the positive and negative direction. This means that there are an infinite number of integers. I must have misspoke earlier.
So are you still sure that number of integers is smaller than the number of rational numbers?

Yes, although the set of integers is infinite, it is still a subset of the set of rational numbers. This means that there are many more rational numbers than there are integers. A rational number is any number that can be expressed as the ratio of two integers, so all integers are rational numbers, but not all rational numbers are integers. For example, the number 1.5 is a rational number, but it is not an integer. Because there are an infinite number of rational numbers that are not integers, the set of rational numbers is larger than the set of integers.
